data.title: Byron Herbert Reece
data.text:
The following titles may be found in the Hall of Fame Library:

Three Lyric Poets: Alice Moser, Tom H. McNeal, and Byron Herbert Reece, Selected, With An Introduction . Prairie City: The Press of J.A. Decker, 1942.

Not The Full Harvest . Los Angeles: Wagon & Star Publishers, 1944.

Ballad Of The Bones, And Other Poems By Byron Herbert Reece . New York: E.P. Dutton & Company, Inc., 1945.

Ballad Of The Bones, And Other Poems By Byron Herbert Reece. New York: E.P. Dutton & Company, Inc., 1946.

Remembrance Of Moab And Other Ballads. Cleveland: American Wave Press, 1949.

Better A Dinner Of Herbs. New York: Dutton, 1950.

Bow Down In Jericho. New York: Dutton, 1950.

A Song Of Joy. New York: Dutton, 1952.

The Hawk And The Sun . New York: Dutton, 1955.

The Season Of Flesh. New York: Dutton, 1955.

Mountain Singer: The Life And The Legacy Of Byron Herbert Reece. Atlanta: Cherokee Pub. Co., 1980.

Better A Dinner Of Herbs: A Novel. Athens: University of Gerogia Press, 1992.

The Hawk And The Sun: A Novel . Athens: University of Georgia Press, 1994.

Fable in the Blood: the Selected Poems of Byron Herbert Reece. Edited by Jim Clark. Athens, GA: UGA Press, 2002.

Faithfully yours: the letters of Byron Herbert Reece. Ed. by Raymond Cook and Alan Jackson. Marietta, GA: Cherokee Publ., 2007.

The Service of Song. [Sound Disc: CD Format.] Words by Byron Herbert Reece; music by Jim Clark. Wilson, NC: Eternal Delight Prod., 2010.
